tools: one type of {@item artisan's tools|XPHB} of your choice

entries: {@i Choose A or B:} (A) {@item Studded Leather Armor|XPHB}, {@item Dagger|XPHB}, {@item Thieves' Tools|XPHB}, {@item Tinker's Tools|XPHB}, {@item Dungeoneer's Pack|XPHB}, and 16 GP; or (B) 150 GP
{@i A Magical Crafter and an Inventor of Wonders}

Masters of invention, Artificers use ingenuity and magic to unlock extraordinary capabilities in objects. They see magic as a complex system waiting to be decoded and then harnessed in their spells and inventions. You can find everything you need to play one of these inventors in the next few sections.

subclassFluff.name: Cartographer
entries: {@i Chart Advantageous Courses through Turmoil}

classFeature.name: Tinker's Magic
entries: You know the {@spell Mending|XPHB} cantrip.
As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action while holding {@item Tinker's Tools|XPHB}, you can create one item in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of yourself, choosing the item from the following list:
See the rules for the item in the {@book Player's Handbook|XPHB}. The item lasts until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, at which point it vanishes.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Replicate Magic Item
entries: You have learned arcane plans that you use to make magic items.

entries.name: Plans Known
entries: When you gain this feature, choose four plans to learn from the {@table Magic Item Plans (Artificer Level 2+)|XUA2025EberronUpdates} table (see the {@book Dungeon Master's Guide|XDMG} for the items' descriptions). {@item Bag of Holding|XDMG}, {@item Cap of Water Breathing|XDMG}, {@item Sending Stones|XDMG}, and {@item +1 Wand of the War Mage|XDMG|Wand of the War Mage +1} are recommended. Whenever you gain an Artificer level, you can replace one of the plans you know with a new plan for which you qualify.
You learn another plan of your choice when you reach certain Artificer levels, as shown in the Plans Known column of the Artificer Features table.
When you choose a plan to learn, you choose it from any Magic Item Plans table for which you qualify; your qualification is based on your Artificer level.

entries.name: Creating an Item
entries: When you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can create one or two different magic items if you have {@item Tinker's Tools|XPHB} in hand. Each item is based on one of the plans you know for this feature.

If a created item requires {@variantrule Attunement|XPHB}, you can attune yourself to it the instant you create it. If you decide to attune to the item later, you must do so using the normal process for {@variantrule Attunement|XPHB}.

When you reach certain Artificer levels specified in the Magic Items column of the Artificer Features table, the number of magic items you can create at the end of a Long Rest increases. Each item you create must be based on a different plan you know.
If you try to exceed your maximum number of magic items for this feature, the oldest item vanishes, and then the new item appears.

entries.name: Duration
entries: A magic item created by this feature functions as the normal magic item, except its magic isn't permanent. When you die, the magic item vanishes after {@dice 1d4} days. If you replace a plan you know with a new plan, any magic item created with the replaced plan immediately vanishes.
If an item that you created with this feature is a container, such as a {@item Bag of Holding|XDMG}, and it vanishes, its contents harmlessly appear in and around its space.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use any {@item Wand|XPHB} or Weapon created by this feature as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} in lieu of using a set of {@item Artisan's Tools|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Artificer Subclass
entries: You gain an Artificer subclass of your choice. The {@subclass Cartographer|Artificer|XUA2025EberronUpdates|XUA2025EberronUpdates} subclass is detailed after this class's description. A subclass is a specialization that grants you features at certain Artificer levels. For the rest of your career, you gain each of your subclass's features that are of your Artificer level or lower.

classFeature.name: Magic Item Tinker
entries: Your {@classFeature Replicate Magic Item|Artificer|XUA2025EberronUpdates|2|XUA2025EberronUpdates} feature gains the following options.

entries.name: Charge Magic Item
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can touch a magic item within 5 feet of yourself that you created with {@classFeature Replicate Magic Item|Artificer|XUA2025EberronUpdates|2|XUA2025EberronUpdates} and uses charges. You recharge the item and expend a level 1+ spell slot. The number of charges an item regains is equal to the level of spell slot expended.

entries.name: Drain Magic Item
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can touch a magic item within 5 feet of yourself that you created with {@classFeature Replicate Magic Item|Artificer|XUA2025EberronUpdates|2|XUA2025EberronUpdates} and cause the item to vanish, converting its magical energy into a spell slot. The slot is level 1 if the item is Common or level 2 if the item is Uncommon or Rare. Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. Any spell slot you create with this feature vanishes when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Transmute Magic Item
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can touch one magic item within 5 feet of yourself that you created with {@classFeature Replicate Magic Item|Artificer|XUA2025EberronUpdates|2|XUA2025EberronUpdates} and transform it into a different magic item. The resulting item must be based on a magic item plan you know. Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Magic Item Adept
entries: You can attune to up to four magic items at once rather than three.

classFeature.name: Spell-Storing Item
entries: Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can touch one Simple or Martial weapon or one item that you can use as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB}, and you store a spell in it, choosing a {@filter level 1, 2, or 3 Artificer spell that has a casting time of an action and doesn't require a Material component that is consumed by the spell|spells|source=|level=1;2;3|class=artificer (xua2025eu)|components & miscellaneous=!material is consumed|cast time=action} (you needn't have the spell prepared).

While holding the object, a creature can take action to produce the spell's effect from it, using your spellcasting ability modifier. If the spell requires {@status Concentration|XPHB}, the creature must {@status Concentration|XPHB|concentrate}. Once a creature has used the object to produce the spell's effect, the object can't be used this way again until the start of the creature's next turn.
The spell stays in the object until it's been used a number of times equal to twice your Intelligence modifier (minimum of twice) or until you use this feature again to store a spell in an object.

classFeature.name: Magic Item Savant
entries: You can now attune to up to five magic items at once rather than three.

classFeature.name: Soul of Artifice
entries: You have developed a mystical connection to your magic items, which you can draw on for aid. You gain the following benefits:

entries.name: Cheat Death
entries: If you're reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} but not killed outright, you can disintegrate any number of Uncommon or Rare magic items created by your {@classFeature Replicate Magic Item|Artificer|XUA2025EberronUpdates|2|XUA2025EberronUpdates} feature. If you do so, you instead drop to a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to 20 times the number of magic items disintegrated.

entries.name: Magical Guidance
entries: Whenever you use your {@classFeature Flash of Genius|Artificer|XUA2024Artificer|7|XUA2024Artificer} and the affected ability check or saving throw still fails, that use of {@classFeature Flash of Genius|Artificer|XUA2024Artificer|7|XUA2024Artificer} isn't expended if you have {@variantrule Attunement|XPHB|Attunment} to at least one magic item.

subclassFeature.name: Adventurer's Atlas
entries: Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} while holding {@item Cartographer's Tools|XPHB}, you can use that tool to create a set of magical maps by touching at least two creatures (one of whom can be yourself), up to a maximum number of creatures equal to 1 plus your Intelligence modifier (minimum of two creatures). Each target receives a magical map, which is illegible to all others. The maps last until you die or until you use this feature again, at which point any existing maps created by this feature immediately vanish.
While carrying the map, a target gains the following benefits.

entries.name: Awareness
entries: The target adds {@dice 1d4} to its {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} rolls.

entries.name: Positioning
entries: The target knows the location of all other map holders that are on the same plane of existence as itself. When casting a spell or creating an effect that requires being able to see the target, a map holder can target another map holder regardless of sight, so long as the other map holder is still within the spell or effect's range.

subclassFeature.name: Cartographer
entries: Cartographers are the premier navigators and reconnaissance agents. Using their creations, Cartographers can highlight threats, safeguard their allies, and carve portals to distant locations.

subclassFeature.name: Cartographer Spells
entries: When you reach an Artificer level specified in the {@table Cartographer Spells|XUA2025EberronUpdates} table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Scouting Gadgets
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Boost
entries: On your turn, you can expend half your movement to teleport to an unoccupied space you can see within 10 feet of yourself. You can't use this benefit if your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is 0.

entries.name: Radar
entries: You can cast {@spell Faerie Fire|XPHB} without expending a spell slot. You can do so a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.

subclassFeature.name: Tool Proficiencies
entries: You gain proficiency with {@item Calligrapher's Supplies|XPHB} and {@item Cartographer's Tools|XPHB}. If you already have one of these proficiencies, you gain proficiency with one other type of {@item Artisan's Tools|XPHB} of your choice. In addition, when you scribe a {@item Spell Scroll|XDMG} using {@book the crafting rules in the Player's Handbook|XPHB|6|Scribing Spell Scrolls}, the amount of time required to craft it is halved.

subclassFeature.name: Portal Jump
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

You can also use this ability without expending a use if the destination space is within 5 feet of a creature carrying a map created with your {@subclassFeature Adventurer's Atlas|Artificer|XUA2025EberronUpdates|Cartographer|XUA2025EberronUpdates|3|XUA2025EberronUpdates}. Doing so destroys the map that creature carries.

subclassFeature.name: Ingenious Movement
entries: When you use your {@classFeature Flash of Genius|Artificer|XUA2024Artificer|7|XUA2024Artificer}, you or a willing creature of your choice you can see within 30 feet of yourself can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see as part of that same {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Superior Atlas
entries: Your {@subclassFeature Adventurer's Atlas|Artificer|XUA2025EberronUpdates|Cartographer|XUA2025EberronUpdates|3|XUA2025EberronUpdates} improves, gaining the following benefits.

entries.name: Safe Haven
entries: When a map holder is reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} but not killed outright, that creature can destroy its map. The creature is then teleported to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you or another map holder of its choice and is {@variantrule Stable|XPHB}.

entries.name: Unerring Path
entries: If you are one of the map holders for your {@subclassFeature Adventurer's Atlas|Artificer|XUA2025EberronUpdates|Cartographer|XUA2025EberronUpdates|3|XUA2025EberronUpdates}, you can cast {@spell Find the Path|XPHB} without expending a spell slot, without preparing the spell, and without needing spell components. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Unshakable Mind
entries: While at least one map created with your {@subclassFeature Adventurer's Atlas|Artificer|XUA2025EberronUpdates|Cartographer|XUA2025EberronUpdates|3|XUA2025EberronUpdates} still exists, taking damage can't cause you to lose {@status Concentration|XPHB} on your Artificer spells.

feat.name: Aberrant Dragonmark
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Aberrant Fortitude
entries: When you make a Constitution saving throw, you can roll {@dice 1d4} and add the number rolled to the save. You can use this benefit a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} and regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Aberrant Magic
entries: You know one {@filter cantrip of your choice from the Sorcerer spell list|spells|source=|level=0|class=sorcerer|components & miscellaneous=}. Also, choose {@filter a level 1 spell from that spell list|spells|source=|level=1|class=sorcerer|components & miscellaneous=}. You always have that spell prepared. You can cast it once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in that way when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also cast this spell using any spell slots you have. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

entries.name: Aberrant Surge
entries: When you cast the level 1 spell from this feat, you can expend one of your {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} and roll it. If you roll an even number, you gain a number of {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the number rolled. If you roll an odd number, one creature within 30 feet of you (not including you) takes Force damage equal to the number rolled. If no other creatures are in range, you take the damage.

feat.name: Mark of Detection
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Deductive Intuition
entries: When you make a Wisdom ({@skill Insight|XPHB} or {@skill Perception|XPHB}) check, you can roll {@dice 1d4} and add the number rolled to the ability check.

entries.name: Magical Detection
entries: You always have the {@spell Detect Magic|XPHB} and {@spell Detect Poison and Disease|XPHB} spells prepared. You can cast each spell once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in that way when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also cast these spells using any spell slots you have. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells (choose when you select this feat).
When you reach character level 3, you also always have the {@spell See Invisibility|XPHB} spell prepared and can cast it the same way.

entries.name: Spells of the Mark
entries: If you have the Spellcasting or Pact Magic feature, the spells on the Mark of Detection Spells table are added to that feature's spell list.

feat.name: Mark of Finding
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Hunter's Intuition
entries: When you make a Wisdom ({@skill Perception|XPHB} or {@skill Survival|XPHB}) check, you can roll {@dice 1d4} and add the number rolled to the ability check.

entries.name: Finder's Magic
entries: You always have the {@spell Hunter's Mark|XPHB} spell prepared. You can cast it once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in that way when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also cast it using any spell slots you have. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells (choose when you select this feat).
When you reach character level 3, you also always have the {@spell Locate Object|XPHB} spell prepared and can cast it the same way.

entries.name: Spells of the Mark
entries: If you have the Spellcasting or Pact Magic feature, the spells on the Mark of Finding Spells table are added to that feature's spell list.

entries.caption: Mark of Finding Spells
rows: {@spell Locate Animals or Plants|XPHB}, {@spell Mind Spike|XPHB}

feat.name: Mark of Handling
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Wild Intuition
entries: When you make an Intelligence ({@skill Nature|XPHB}) or Wisdom ({@skill Animal Handling|XPHB}) check, you can roll {@dice 1d4} and add the number rolled to the ability check.

entries.name: Primal Connection
entries: You always have the {@spell Animal Friendship|XPHB} and {@spell Speak with Animals|XPHB} spells prepared. You can cast each spell once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in that way when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also cast these spells using any spell slots you have. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells (choose when you select this feat).

entries.name: The Bigger They Are
entries: When you reach character level 3, you can target a Monstrosity when you cast {@spell Animal Friendship|XPHB} or {@spell Speak with Animals|XPHB} if the creature's Intelligence score is 3 or lower.

entries.name: Spells of the Mark
entries: If you have the Spellcasting or Pact Magic feature, the spells on the Mark of Handling Spells table are added to that feature's spell list.

feat.name: Mark of Healing
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Medical Intuition
entries: When you make an Intelligence ({@item Herbalism Kit|XPHB}) or Wisdom ({@skill Medicine|XPHB}) check, you can roll {@dice 1d4} and add the number rolled to the ability check.

entries.name: Healing Touch
entries: You always have the {@spell Cure Wounds|XPHB} spell prepared. You can cast it once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in that way when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also cast it using any spell slots you have. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells (choose when you select this feat).
When you reach character level 3, you also always have the {@spell Lesser Restoration|XPHB} spell prepared and can cast it the same way.

entries.name: Spells of the Mark
entries: If you have the Spellcasting or Pact Magic feature, the spells on the Mark of Healing Spells table are added to that feature's spell list.

entries.caption: Mark of Healing Spells
rows: {@spell Aura of Vitality|XPHB}, {@spell Mass Healing Word|XPHB}
{@spell Aura of Life|XPHB}, {@spell Aura of Purity|XPHB}

feat.name: Mark of Hospitality
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Ever Hospitable
entries: When you make a Charisma ({@skill Persuasion|XPHB}) check or an ability check using {@item Brewer's Supplies|XPHB} or {@item Cook's Utensils|XPHB}, you can roll {@dice 1d4} and add the number rolled to the ability check.

entries.name: Innkeeper's Magic
entries: You know the {@spell Prestidigitation|XPHB} cantrip. You also always have the {@spell Purify Food and Drink|XPHB} and {@spell Unseen Servant|XPHB} spells prepared. You can cast each spell once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in that way when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also cast these spells using any spell slots you have. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells (choose when you select this feat).

entries.name: Spells of the Mark
entries: If you have the Spellcasting or Pact Magic feature, the spells on the Mark of Hospitality Spells table are added to that feature's spell list.

entries.caption: Mark of Hospitality Spells
rows: {@spell Create Food and Water|XPHB}, {@spell Leomund's Tiny Hut|XPHB}
{@spell Aura of Purity|XPHB}, {@spell Mordenkainen's Private Sanctum|XPHB}

feat.name: Mark of Making
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Artisan's Intuition
entries: When you make an Intelligence ({@skill Arcana|XPHB}) check or an ability check using {@item Artisan's Tools|XPHB}, you can roll {@dice 1d4} and add the number rolled to the ability check.

entries.name: Spellsmith
entries: You know the {@spell Mending|XPHB} cantrip. You also always have the {@spell Magic Weapon|XPHB} spell prepared. You can cast it once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in that way when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also cast it using any spell slots you have. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells (choose when you select this feat).

entries.name: Spells of the Mark
entries: If you have the Spellcasting or Pact Magic feature, the spells on the Mark of Making Spells table are added to that feature's spell list.

item.name: Manifold Tool
entries: This tool takes the form of a wrench, screwdriver, or other basic tool. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can touch the item and transform it into a type of {@item Artisan's Tools|XPHB} of your choice. Whatever form the tool takes, you have proficiency with it when you use it.

table.name: Cartographer Spells
rows: {@spell Faerie Fire|XPHB}, {@spell Guiding Bolt|XPHB}, {@spell Healing Word|XPHB}

table.name: Magic Item Plans (Artificer Level 10+)
rows: {@filter Uncommon Wondrous Item that isn't cursed|items|source=|type=wondrous item|rarity=uncommon|category=|miscellaneous=!cursed} (you can learn this option multiple times and must select a different item each time; each item selected counts as a different plan)
{@item +2 Wand of the War Mage|XDMG|Wand of the War Mage +2}
{@item +2 Wraps of Unarmed Power|XDMG|Wraps of Unarmed Power +2}

table.name: Magic Item Plans (Artificer Level 14+)
rows: {@filter Rare Wondrous Item that isn't cursed|items|source=|type=wondrous item|rarity=rare|category=|miscellaneous=!cursed} (you can learn this option multiple times and must select a different item each time; each item selected counts as a different plan)

table.name: Magic Item Plans (Artificer Level 2+)
rows: {@filter Common magic item that isn't a Potion, a Scroll, or cursed|items|source=|type=!potion;!scroll|rarity=common|category=|miscellaneous=!cursed} (you can learn this option multiple times and must select a different item each time; each item selected counts as a different plan)
{@item +1 Wand of the War Mage|XDMG|Wand of the War Mage +1}
{@item +1 Wraps of Unarmed Power|XDMG|Wraps of Unarmed Power +1}

table.name: Magic Item Plans (Artificer Level 6+)
rows: {@item Boots of the Winding Path|XUA2024Artificer} (appears in this UA)

data.name: Unearthed Arcana 2025: Eberron Updates
entries: This playtest document is part of a series of {@i Unearthed Arcana} articles that present material designed for upcoming books. The material here uses the rules in the {@book 2024 Player's Handbook|XPHB}.

entries.name: Learn More on YouTube
entries: To learn more about the design in this article, we invite you to view the videos about it on YouTube ({@link www.youtube.com/DNDWizards}).

items.name: Artificer
entries: The Artificer class appears again, with some updates since its last appearance in Unearthed Arcana.

items.name: New Subclass: Cartographer
entries: A new subclass for the Artificer, the Cartographer, provides new ways for the Artificer to demonstrate its ingenuity.

items.name: Additional Magic Options
entries: Updated versions of the new spell and new magic items compatible with the Artificer are presented here.

items.name: Dragonmarks
entries: Also included are a collection of feats that provide a new way to join the dragonmarked houses of Eberron. These feats allow characters of any species to take and improve their dragonmarks. Backgrounds representing a character's connection will be included with these feats in a future book if they become official, but in the meantime a character who takes the House Agent background can choose a Dragonmarked feat, and any character can choose one of these feats when their class normally allows a feat choice.

entries.name: This Is Playtest Material
entries: This article is presented for playtesting and feedback. The options here are experimental and in draft form. They aren't officially part of the game. Your feedback will help determine whether we adopt it as official.

items.name: How to Playtest This UA
entries: We invite you to try out this material in play. To play with this material, you may either incorporate it into your campaign or run one or more special playtest sessions. For such a session, you may create an adventure of your own or use a short adventure from a source like {@adventure Quests from the Infinite Staircase|QftIS}.

items.name: Power Level
entries: The character options you read here might be more or less powerful than options in the {@book 2024 Player's Handbook|XPHB}. If a design survives playtesting, we adjust its power to the desirable level before publication. This means an option could be more or less powerful in its final form.

items.name: Feedback
entries: The best way for you to give us feedback on this material is in the survey we'll release on D&D Beyond. If we make this material official, it will be refined based on your feedback, and then it will appear in a D&D book.
Providing feedback on this document is one way you can help shape the future of D&D!

entries.name: Artificer
entries: {@i A Magical Crafter and an Inventor of Wonders}

Masters of invention, Artificers use ingenuity and magic to unlock extraordinary capabilities in objects. They see magic as a complex system waiting to be decoded and then harnessed in their spells and inventions. You can find everything you need to play one of these inventors in the next few sections.

entries.name: As a Level 1 Character
items: Gain all the traits in the Core Artificer Traits table.
Gain the Artificer's level 1 features, which are listed in the Artificer Features table.

entries.name: As a Multiclass Character
items: Gain the following traits from the {@table Core Artificer Traits|XUA2024Artificer} table: Hit Point Die, proficiency with {@item Tinker's Tools|XPHB}, proficiency in one skill of your choice from the Artificer's skill list, and training with Light and Medium armor and Shields.

Gain the Artificer's level 1 features, which are listed in the Artificer Features table. See the multiclassing rules in the {@book Player's Handbook|XPHB|2|Multiclassing} to determine your available spell slots, adding half your Artificer levels (round up).

entries.name: Artificer Class Features
entries: As an Artificer, you gain the following class features when you reach the specified Artificer levels. These features are listed on the Artificer Features table.

entries.name: Design Note: Artificer Updates
entries: Here are the main updates in this class since its last appearance in {@book Unearthed Arcana|XUA2024Artificer}:

items.name: Tinker's Magic
entries: (formerly {@classFeature Magical Tinkering|Artificer|XUA2024Artificer|1|XUA2024Artificer}) now gives the {@spell Mending|XPHB} cantrip, and items created with this feature last until you finish a Long Rest.

items.name: Replicate Magic Item
entries: 's tables have been revised. You can now use a {@item Wand|XPHB} or Weapon created by this feature as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB}.

items.name: Magic Item Tinker
entries: has been expanded to allow you to recharge magic items by expending spell slots and transform one magic item into a different item.

items.name: Soul of Artifice
entries: now lets you disintegrate any number of items to increase the number of regained Hit Points and allows for more reliable usage of {@classFeature Flash of Genius|Artificer|XUA2024Artificer|7|XUA2024Artificer}.

entries.name: Artificer Spell List
entries: This section presents the Artificer spell list. The spells are organized by spell level and then alphabetized, and each spell's school of magic is listed. In the Special column, {@i C} means the spell requires {@status Concentration|XPHB}, {@i R} means it's a {@variantrule Ritual|XPHB}, and {@i M} means it requires a specific Material component.

entries.name: Artificer Subclass
entries: An Artificer subclass is a specialization that grants you features at certain Artificer levels, as specified in the subclass. This section presents a new subclass, the {@subclass Cartographer|Artificer|XUA2025EberronUpdates|XUA2025EberronUpdates}.

entries.name: Cartographer
entries: {@i Chart Advantageous Courses through Turmoil}

entries.name: Spells
entries: Spells are presented in alphabetical order.

entries.name: Magic Items
entries: Magic items are presented in alphabetical order.

entries.name: Feats
entries: This section presents twenty-eight new feats.

entries.name: Dragonmark Feats
entries: These feats are in the Dragonmark category.

entries.name: General Feats
entries: These new feats are in the General category.

entries.name: Epic Boon Feats
entries: This feat is in the Epic Boon category.
